  def selectionSort(arr):
      tmp = list(arr);
      for i in range(0,len(tmp)):
          minIdx = i;
          for j in range(i+1, len(tmp)):
              if (tmp[i] < tmp[j]):
                  minIdx = i;
              else:
                  minIdx = j;
          if (minIdx != i):
              minNum = tmp[minIdx];
              tmp.pop(minIdx);
              tmp.insert(i, minNum);
      return tmp;

const a = [1,2,3,4,5]
const b = 9
function sum(arr, weight){
  for(let i=0; i<arr.length; i++){
    for (let j=i+1; j<arr.length; j++){
      if (arr[i] + arr[j] === weight){
        return [arr[i], arr[j]]

    }
  }
  return -1
}

const a = [1,2,3,4,5]
const b = 9
function sum(arr, weight){
  const hash = {}
  for (let i=0; i<arr.length; i++){
    const currentElement = arr[i];
    const difference = weight - currentElement
    if(hash[currentElement]){
      return [hash[currentElement], arr[i]];
    }else{
      hash[difference] = i+1
    }
  }
  return -1
}

/**
 * base: ë°‘
 * exponent: ì§€ìˆ˜
 * modulus: ë‚˜ëˆ„ëŠ” ìˆ˜

function modular(base, exponent, modulus){
  if (modulus === 1) return 0;
  let value = 1;
  for (let i=0; i<exponent; i++){
    value = (value * base) % modulus;
  }
  return value;
}

items.title: How to fix urara build bug while using gh-pages
items.content_html:
After deploying, page could not be loaded css files. Like that.

I could access all the files in gh-pages branch, except â€_appâ€ directory. So I wanted to change name of directory.

  1. Modified Build File

    What I wanted is to rename â€_appâ€ to â€œappâ€.

    This project has some build setting files

    • tsconfig.json
    • svelte.config.js
    • urara.ts

    I modified build setting by changing those files, but couldnâ€™t fix it.

  2. Make .nojekyll at root of build directory, and deploy.

    I found that if deploy branch doesnâ€™t have .nojekyll, then Github Page serves page as Jekyll build.

    gh-pages needs .nojekyll file

    build script runs like run-s tsc urara:build kit:build clean that means

    1. run-s : run sequentially
    2. tsc : tsc -p tsconfig.node.json
    3. urara:build : node urara.js build
    4. kit:build : cross-env NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=7680 vite build
    5. clean : node urara.js clean

    Before cleaning directories, I add .nojekyll file in build directory.

    1. make nojekyll function in urara.ts

      js
      const nojekyll = () => {
        fs.writeFile('build/.nojekyll', '')
      }

    2. Add â€˜nojekyllâ€™ case in switch case syntax

      js
      case 'nojekyll':
        nojekyll();
        break;

    3. Add that code in package.json

      json
      {
        "script": {
          "nojekyll": "node urara.js nojekyll",
          "gh-pages": "npm run build && npm run nojekyll && npx gh-pages -t -d build"
        }
      }

      gh-pages -t means uploading files started with â€™.â€™

After doing that, you can finally deploy the perfect Homepage. Enjoy :)

The .save() is an instance method of the model, while the .create() is called directly from the Model as a method call, being static in nature, and takes the object as a first parameter.

  • save()

    • saveëŠ” instance ë©”ì„œë“œë¡œ, ê°ì²´ë¥¼ ì§ì ‘ í˜•ì„±í•´ì¤€ í›„ ëª½ê³ ë””ë¹„ì— ì €ì¥í•˜ëŠ” í˜•ì‹ì´ë‹¤.
    js
    const Person = mongoose.model(
      'Person',
      Schema({
        name: String,
        age: Number
      })
    )
    let newPerson = new Person({
      name: 'jack',
      age: 30
    })
    await newPerson.save()

  • create()

    • createëŠ” static ë©”ì„œë“œë¡œ, ê°ì²´ë¥¼ ë”°ë¡œ ìƒì„±í•˜ì§€ ì•Šì•„ë„ í˜¸ì¶œì„ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤. create ë‚´ë¶€ì— ìƒì„±í•˜ê³ ì í•˜ëŠ” ë°ì´í„°ë¥¼ ë„£ì–´ì£¼ë©´, mongodbì— ì €ì¥ì´ ëœë‹¤.
    js
    const Person = mongoose.model(
      'Person',
      Schema({
        name: String,
        age: Number
      })
    )
    await Person.create({ name: 'jack', age: 30 })

items.title: Hello World
items.content_html:
Welcome to Urara! this article contains some basic operations to help you quickly get started.

Developing

Start a development server:

bash
# http://127.0.0.1:5173
pnpm dev

or listen to different IP and port:

bash
# http://127.0.0.1:3000
pnpm dev --port 3000
# http://0.0.0.0:3000
nr dev --host 0.0.0.0 --port 3000

Building

Create a production version of ur blog:

bash
pnpm build

u can preview the built app with pnpm preview.

Documentation

For full documentation, visit urara-docs.netlify.app.
